articles.headline: Bournemouth Councillor Relieved Over New Lidl Store Postponement

story_classification.reasoning: Local government/planning news. Requires institutional context about planning committees and development proposals. Standard reporting with council spokesperson.

beat_context.reasoning: Local government/urban planning beat. Not inherently gendered - planning decisions involve all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Joe Salmon
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: BCP Councillor directly involved in the planning decision being covered. He IS part of the story - representing local interests in the planning committee. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he is THE councillor who raised objections and secured the deferral.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Planning committee defers proposed Lidl store on Westover Retail Park

articles.headline: 20 Year-Old Man on Trial for Manslaughter Following Stabbing

story_classification.reasoning: Court proceedings/crime reporting. Requires institutional context about legal process. Standard hard news reporting.

beat_context.reasoning: Crime/court reporting beat. Not inherently gendered - trials involve all genders as defendants, victims, and experts.

quoted_sources.name: Dr Jefferies
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Forensic analyst providing expert testimony. External authority with professional expertise, not directly affected by the crime. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? YES - any qualified forensic analyst could provide similar medical testimony.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Thomas Betteridge on trial for manslaughter of Cameron Hamilton

articles.headline: Why Young People Should Join Orchestra

story_classification.reasoning: Feature-length piece driven by musicians' lived experiences in orchestras. Rich with personal narratives about teamwork, mental health benefits, and performance anxiety. Observation-based storytelling about human side of orchestra life.

beat_context.reasoning: Classical music/orchestra beat. Not inherently gendered - orchestras include musicians of all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Emily Davis
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Violinist sharing personal 20-year experience with London Philharmonia Orchestra. She IS experiencing orchestra life - sharing lived experience, not replaceable expertise. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - personal narrative about her journey.

quoted_sources.name: Michael Chaffin
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Sub-Principal Double Bass with BSO sharing personal experience and involvement in Explore the Orchestra concerts. He IS part of orchestra life, not external expert. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - personal experience narrative.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Benefits of orchestral participation for young people

articles.headline: Poole Trampoline Athlete Jared Smith Sets Sights on European Glory

story_classification.reasoning: Sports profile/preview piece. While includes Jared's perspective, this is standard sports reporting about upcoming competition rather than experiential journey narrative.

beat_context.reasoning: Trampolining/gymnastics beat. Not inherently gendered - sport includes male and female competitors.

quoted_sources.name: Jared Smith
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Trampolinist preparing for European Championship - he IS the story subject. Cannot be replaced by another expert. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he is THE athlete being profiled.

quoted_sources.name: Ryan Brown
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Team GB athlete and teammate providing assessment of Jared's preparation. He IS part of the training environment/team, not external expert. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he's a teammate with direct knowledge of Jared's performance.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Jared Smith preparing for European Championship trials

story_classification.reasoning: Shorthand feature profiling college staff strikes through personal stories. Driven by lived experiences of Ivan Darley and Anne Marie Moriarty sharing their frustrations, struggles, and motivations. Human-centered narrative about labor action.

beat_context.reasoning: Labor/education strike beat. Not inherently gendered - strikes involve all genders.

quoted_sources.name: Ivan Darley
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Maths teacher at Bournemouth and Poole College on strike. He IS the story - participant in the strike action sharing personal experience of pay disparity. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - he's a striker sharing lived experience.

quoted_sources.name: Anne Marie Moriarty
quoted_sources.role_reasoning: Vice Chair and Secretary of Bournemouth and Poole College UCU branch on strike. She IS the story - strike organizer sharing personal stake in labor action. Test: Could this source be replaced by another expert? NO - she's a striker and union leader with personal involvement.

stakeholder_mapping.core_event: Bournemouth and Poole College staff three-day strike over pay and conditions
